column4: hi. I'm having some problems with crontab. it does not execute one script sometimes... =/
the exact cronjob and maybe usefull infos from /var/log/syslog
script: http://pastie.org/5194653          syslog: http://pastie.org/5194666           crontab: http://pastie.org/5194669
there you are missing bash  if the script is not executable the script will not start
i know, but that is not relevent. the script begins with a #!/bin/bash and if you see the time, the one that in syslog wasn't exectuted was the one at 10:50 AM an that had the bash before
the script will only executed if it has chmod +x  the shebang is not important for that, but that is just an info, seems its executable in your case
and i dont see a script which sould start on 10:50
yes, it is. It has 755 permissions
yea, you're right. i misstyped there. the last one is me testing for see if it is working
always changing to a few minute after editing it
yea, i probably should have done that. or making it execute every 2 minutes or so
changed it to 00-59/5. lets see if it works. because it worked the last time i changed the date... not sure if it will work allways tho =/
